news_header: An advert by fashion brand Next was banned due to the model's pose and camera angle suggesting she was 'unhealthily thin'. The Advertising Standards Authority (ASA) found the emphasis on the model's slim legs irresponsible, despite the model being described as healthy by Next. The ASA ruled that the ad breached social responsibility codes and should not be used again in its current form.
news_original_title: Next ad banned as pose made model look too thin
news_text: The ruling reflects ongoing concerns about unrealistic body images in advertising and their impact on mental health, as well as a potential regression in body positivity within the fashion industry.
